formalText: It's like well, he can't make it perfect so he might as well just not try to do anything at all.
He wonders why it is that he can't process all of what's happening or happened.
He wonders if there's a different set of contracts or tools or features about oneself that allow him to process emotional or emotions and feelings?
He feels like things are ruined.
The disappointment is related to this, and he has a tendency to despair.
Tanya and he and dr. Janice talked

a couple weeks ago about anger and the sense in which one of them, not the only, but one of the causes of her self injury and suicide is her utter inability to deal with the anger from anyone else or herself.
